meanings.definition: To fertilize (a plant) by transferring pollen.
meanings.sent1: Bees help pollinize flowers by carrying pollen from one to another.
meanings.sent2: The wind can also pollinize plants by carrying pollen grains.
meanings.sent3: The sneezing panda accidentally pollinized all the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The music festival pollinized the town with a sense of joy and excitement.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly delicately pollinized the blooming flowers with its fluttering wings.

meanings.definition: To cause (a plant) to be fertilized by pollen.
meanings.sent1: Gardeners can pollinize plants by gently transferring pollen from one flower to another.
meanings.sent2: The bee's buzzing helps pollinize the apple tree, leading to fruit production.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to pollinize the garden by sprinkling pollen everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to pollinize the room, spreading happiness to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The rainstorm effectively pollinized the crops, ensuring a bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: To transfer pollen from one flower to another.
meanings.sent1: Hummingbirds pollinize flowers as they move from one bloom to the next.
meanings.sent2: Insects like bees and butterflies play a crucial role in pollinizing various plants.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to pollinize the daisies by blowing pollen off one flower onto another.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to pollinize the audience, spreading inspiration and motivation.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze helped pollinize the garden, carrying pollen from one flower to another.
